revised_title: The Bacterial Production of Acetylmethylcarbinol and 2,3-Butylene Glycol from Various Substances
tldr: The authors investigate the bacterial production of acetylmethylcarbinol and 2,3-butylene glycol from various substances, including glycerol, mannitol, and glucose. They find that acetylmethylcarbinol is produced in all cases, while glyceraldehyde is not detected, challenging the theory that sugars undergoing bacterial fermentation break down primarily to trioses.
